intro: Centaurea intricata subsp. kermanshahensis, commonly known as the Kermanshah centaurea, is a perennial herb native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a compact inflorescence. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential for medicinal use.
